name: Amethyst
body:
### amethyst ([soon to be renamed](https://docs.google.com/forms/d/1R-epMSA_GaeaEZilc_D6k8vo8TXJMvZDZlgQDMFsHFQ/viewform))

A programming language with both minimalism and utility in mind. It is inspired by TI-Basic.

### Example?

```
_ Returns the nth Fibonacci number.
_ For n = 0, produces an extraneous result of 1.
$fib = λ
  l = 0
  u = 1
  For i, 2, #1
    t = u
    u += l
    l = t
  EndFor
  u
Endλ
```

### Version 0.5.x

Later versions may contain functions missing in earlier versions. The latest is **0.5.12**.

### Roadmap to 0.6

- [x] bitwise operators
- [x] math functions
- [x] time functions
- [ ] collection functions
- [ ] random functions

In order to enhance friendliness to new programmers, the `=` token will now be interpreted as equality, and assignment will use a left arrow (which will be available for input on the GUI).

### Questions

#### Will named parameters be supported; e. g. `f(x)=x^2`?

There are no plans to support named parameters at this moment.

#### Why do you plan to rename Amethyst?

Already taken.

#### Are there any communities I can join?

There will be as soon as we agree upon a new name.

#### How do I install?

[あなたばかです。](https://github.com/bluebear94/amethyst/blob/master/README.md)

#### Why does, for example, calling `$:cdr` on a large list take so much time?

Amethyst vigilantly clones values on assignment, in order to avoid unnecessary mutation and model TI-Basic. Chances are that you can use a function such as `$:foldl` to do the same thing.
